item.description:
Carnival - translation from carny talk in purple

Here’s the call and they won’t be no alibi attached.

Below is a description of what we’ll be doing at the June cooking club and there are no hidden rules so just have fun.

Ok everyone get your carny on and join us at our grub joint in June.

Just be yourself and come to the usual spot where the cooking club meets in June.

Just so you know this ain’t no Key to the Midway move, I am listing some of the favs of Sharpies from coast to coast.

I don’t want you to think this type of food is an impossible task so I have listed some traditional favorites of carnival and fair foods from across the USA.

Your job is to spring these favs by flashing the Ikey Heyman.

What you need to do is pick a carnival food and then make it closer to gourmet by starting with fresh ingredients and making it from scratch, i.e. no frozen corn dogs.

Your entry will include a view of the only two headed, double horned unicorn in captivity!

I hope you can join us in June!

Anything on a stick qualifies as carny food.
Corndogs, roasted corn, funnel cake, cotton candy, taffy, slushy lemonade, kettle corn, sweet salty fried anything, elephant ears, deep fried dill pickles, tacos, onion blossoms, caramel apples, softserv, fried dough, fried cheese curds, and one you may not have heard of before - Korean hot dogs on a stick (these are corndogs but the corn meal battered hot dog is rolled in French fries and then fried so that the French fries are in the dough and sticking out all over the corndog on the stick.)
Since fried foods play a big role in these examples it would be great if someone has a turkey fryer we could set up in the back yard and use for everything. Let me know if you have one to loan us.

http://www.newsweek.c...

Of course carnival could mean

http://www.carnival.c...

or

It could mean Mardi Grae though to wear those outfits of feathers and sparkles with any degree of confidence I don’t think fried foods are involved, or any food…. Just steel drums and steel abs.

Remember, this is about your creativity and personal interpretation.
Plan to cook onsite unless your recipe takes more than an hour to prepare. The fun is in the cooking here all together.

Weather permitting we may be out side in June, bring a lawn chair!
item.how_to_find_us: my home so you will notice me and the dogs will send address a few days before
item.name: The Hartford Cooking And Recipes June Meetup
